artist: Artist: Jacques Villon; Author: Max Jacobs; Publisher: Louis Broder
creditline: Gift of Ruth and Bruce Dayton
description: paper-covered book with loose, folded pages; grey hardcover fits into black sleeve; sleeve rests in tan box
dimension: 7 7/8 x 6 3/4 x 1 11/16 in. (20 x 17.15 x 4.29 cm) (overall, closed)
image_copyright: © Artists Rights Society %28ARS%29%2C New York %2F ADAGP%2C Paris
medium: Color soft-ground etching and letterpress, with black-and-white etching on cover; bound volume

signed: on colophon page, in pencil: [Jacques Villon]
text: Gaston Duchamp liked literature so much that he adopted the name Jacques Villon, after the early French poet François Villon. Usually regarded as a Cubist printmaker, Villon took a surprising turn with the prose poetry of Max Jacob, who had died in 1944 in a German prison camp. Clearly enchanted with Jacob's comical-mystical verse, Villon created small abstractions using multiple plates superimposed over faintly drawn lines.
title: A poèms rompus (Broken Poems)
